nodes.bodyText:
@mnriem , We can add java code in README.md to src/samples/java. So we can:

Make sure the java code in README.md can be compiled without error.
Make sure the java code in README.md to be latest.

Refs:

https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/parents/azure-sdk-parent/pom.xml#L109
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/parents/azure-client-sdk-parent/pom.xml#L1196-L1338

Sample:

https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blame/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-spring-data-cosmos/README.md#L92

nodes.bodyText: we should delete all <skip>true</skip> and make build pass.
I will be addressing the <skip>true</skip> parts in a subsequent PR
KeyVaultCertificate is not used except in test code?
URL in line 256 is not updated.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -246,7 +246,7 @@ Notes:
 1. The alias (certificate name) is constructed from the filename of the 
 certificate (minus the extension). So if your filename is `mycert.x509` the
 certificate will be added with the alias of `mycert`. 
-2. Certificates coming from Azure KeyVault take precedence over 
+2. Certificates coming from Azure Key Vault take precedence over 
 side-loaded certificates.
 
 ## Testing the current version under development

 certificate (minus the extension). So if your filename is `mycert.x509` the
 certificate will be added with the alias of `mycert`. 
-2. Certificates coming from Azure KeyVault take precedence over

 side-loaded certificates.

nodes.bodyText: This section should be somewhere other than the bottom to have more visibility. What about as a part of "Getting Started"?

 Note if you want to use Azure managed identity, you should set the value

nodes.bodyText: We should not include these sections just so that the CI pipelines don't complain. I think that, for the sake of consistency, we should make it so that this README is in line with the one for the Secrets Spring Boot Starter. We can always include the information above in a section where it makes sense, even additional to the ones below if you think that's better.
